column5: I've never tried ice fishing before, but I would like to try this winter. However, what time of the year does the ice become stable enough in southern Ontario for ice fishing to be safe? Thanks.
Depends on the weather and the ice     I don't usually go out til there's a good 4 inches of ice, but have fished on 2 inches before.
when the ice hut operators put their huts out is when tracker and i go out. but every year we have the same argument: you first, no you first, no i insist you first. LOL
I just follow Joey and Paul out.....

..and I follow Terry picking up the lost items!  If it hadn't been for this +2 we'd be on the ice... although it's at least soaked the snow and that will help next week when the temps drop again..pray for NO snow!
I wait for Andy to say, BP has 2 inches,it,s good to go. I use to be one of those first guys,but like they say,one year older,makes ya one year wiser.   LOL @ Skeeter.

Posted Today, 03:03 PM  I've never ice fished in my life, but I want to try this winter. However, what time of the year typically does the ice become stable enough for safe ice fishing in southern Ontario? Thanks.**************************************************** hummmmm same post, different forum. I guess he needs more info than we can provide on this forum.
I guess you do as well Paul if you hang out elsewhere...
I wait for 4" otherwise the Mrs calls every 5 min. to see if I've gone in or not.  The car wait's on shore for more then 12" of ice.  Like others said, I tend to follow OR push...
I went this morning on 8 inches and we got 10 specks...but thats up here
